00088         template <class T>
00089                 MemoryBuffer<T>::MemoryBuffer(uint32_t count) : m_buffer(0), m_length(count){
00090                         if(m_length){
00091                                 m_buffer = (T*)malloc(count * sizeof(T));
00092                                 if(!m_buffer)
00093                                         MT_EXCEPTION(mt::Exception, "MemoryBuffer: Failed to allocate " << count << " units.");
00094                         }
00095         }
00096

00098                 MemoryBuffer<T>::MemoryBuffer(const MemoryBuffer<T>& src) : m_buffer(0), m_length(0){
00099                 operator=(src);
00100         }
00101 
00102         template <class T>
00103                 MemoryBuffer<T>::~MemoryBuffer<T>(){
00104                 if(m_buffer)
00105                         free((void*)m_buffer);
00106                 }

00109         MemoryBuffer<T>::operator const T* () const {
00110                 return m_buffer;
00111         }

00114                 MemoryBuffer<T>::operator T* (){
00115                 return m_buffer;

00119                 uint32_t MemoryBuffer<T>::length() const {
00120                 return m_length;

00123         template <class T>
00124                 uint32_t MemoryBuffer<T>::append(T* src, uint32_t size ){
00125                 if(0==(m_buffer=(T*)realloc((void*)m_buffer,sizeof(T)*(m_length+size)))) {
00126                         MT_EXCEPTION(mt::Exception, "MemoryBuffer<>::append Failed to allocate " << m_length + size<< " of type '" <<  typeid(T).name() << "'");
00127                 } else {
00128                         memcpy(m_buffer+m_length, src, size*sizeof(T));
00129                         m_length += size;
00130                 }
00131                 return m_length;
00132         }
00133 
00134         template <class T>
00135                 uint32_t MemoryBuffer<T>::append(const MemoryBuffer<T>& src ){
00136                 return append( src, src.m_length);
00137         }
00138 
00139         template <class T>
00140                 MemoryBuffer<T>& MemoryBuffer<T>::operator=(const MemoryBuffer<T>& src){
00141                 if(m_buffer)
00142                         free((void*)m_buffer);
00143 
00144                 m_length=src.m_length;
00145                 m_buffer=(T*)malloc(m_length*sizeof(T));
00146                 if(!m_buffer) {
00147                         MT_EXCEPTION(mt::Exception, "MemoryBuffer<>::failed to acclocate memory. Requested size=" << m_length << " elements of '"
00148                                                                          << typeid(T).name() << "'");
00149                 }
00150                 memcpy(m_buffer,src.m_buffer,m_length*sizeof(T));
00151                 return *this;
00152         }
00153 
00154         template <class T>
00155                 uint32_t MemoryBuffer<T>::truncate(uint32_t startPos, int32_t length) {
00156                         if( startPos<0 || startPos>m_length )
00157                                 MT_EXCEPTION(mt::Exception, "MemoryBuffer: Out of bounds.current length=" << m_length << " but start=" << startPos);
00158 
00159                         if( length!=-1 && startPos+length>m_length ) {
00160                                 MT_EXCEPTION(mt::Exception, "MemoryBuffer: Out of bounds.Start " << startPos << " + Length="
00161                                                                                  << length << " exceeds current length of data " << m_length );
00162                         }
00163 
00164                         if( -1==length )
00165                                 length = m_length - startPos;
00166                         T* newbuf=(T*)malloc(length*sizeof(T));
00167                         if(0==newbuf)
00168                                 MT_EXCEPTION(mt::Exception, "MemoryBuffer: Failed to allocate " << length << " units of '" << typeid(T).name() << "'");
00169                         memcpy( newbuf, m_buffer+startPos, length );
00170                         free((void*)m_buffer);
00171                         m_buffer = newbuf;
00172                         m_length = length;
00173                         return m_length;
00174                 }
